arm_group.arm_group_label: Low-level laser therapy (LLLT) on muscle damage
arm_group.description: Effects of low-level laser therapy (LLLT)on muscle damage

arm_group.arm_group_label: Low-level laser therapy (LLLT) placebo on muscle damage
arm_group.description: Effects of low-level laser therapy (LLLT) placebo on muscle damage

brief_summary.textblock:
The study hypothesis is a decreased muscle damage induced by exercises when low-level laser
      therapy is applied on body muscles before exercises.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Low-level Laser Therapy (808nm) on Marker of Muscle Damage

detailed_description.textblock:
The study assessed males submitted to exercise to induce muscle damage. Creatine kinase
      levels in blood was quantified in order to identify the magnitude of muscle damage.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  healthy males,

          -  physically active,

          -  aged between 25-40 years.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  smoker, or

          -  under medicine as anti-inflammatory and/or any drug that could affect normal and
             physiological conditions and lesion in upper limbs.

arm_group_label: Low-level laser therapy (LLLT) on muscle damage
Low-level laser therapy (LLLT) placebo on muscle damage
intervention.description: Use of low-level laser therapy(LLLT)or placebo-LLLT applied on biceps brachii for muscle damage recovery

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Low-level Laser Therapy (808nm) on Marker of Muscle Damage: Randomized Double-blind Placebo-controlled Study

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: National Committee of Ethics in Research

primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of Creatine Kinase (CK) levels in blood before, immediately after and 24h, 48h and 72h after protocol of exercise to induce muscle damage

reference.citation: Vieira WH, Ferraresi C, Perez SE, Baldissera V, Parizotto NA. Effects of low-level laser therapy (808 nm) on isokinetic muscle performance of young women submitted to endurance training: a randomized controlled clinical trial. Lasers Med Sci. 2012 Mar;27(2):497-504. Epub 2011 Aug 26.

Ferraresi C, de Brito Oliveira T, de Oliveira Zafalon L, de Menezes Reiff RB, Baldissera V, de Andrade Perez SE, Matheucci Júnior E, Parizotto NA. Effects of low level laser therapy (808 nm) on physical strength training in humans. Lasers Med Sci. 2011 May;26(3):349-58. doi: 10.1007/s10103-010-0855-0. Epub 2010 Nov 18.
